result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L. Flint was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming or counseling as directed by the agent.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  Court has ordered one set of court costs.

Upon successful completion of probation, Defendant to be eligible for first offender's treatment for expungement per 973.015.  Defendant to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Counts 1 and 2 are concurrent with each other and concurrent with 16CM115.

Costs owed have been converted to civil judgment, owed by Defendant to the Clerk of Court.

* This is a time served sentence. *

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin L. Flint

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue - Not Deliverable As Addressed, Unable to Forward

Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court, in custody, with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Judge Koehler appears by phone.

Atty. Forehand notes this is DA Harper's case. Counsel indicate that global offer has been made involving this case and a case that's in front of Judge Sharp. Atty. McDougal states the parties are asking for 30 days jail on each revoked count, concurrent with each other and concurrent with 16CM115 (a stayed and imposed case); states that the def has 70 days credit.

Court sentences Def on counts 1 and 2, both having been revoked. Court orders 30 days jail on count 1 and 30 days jail on count 2, to run concurrent with each other and concurrent with the 120 days def was ordered to serve in 16CM115. Credit is 70 days.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 11, 2018 at 02:30 pm.
(SEHR date requested from Iowa County JA)

of Conviction - defendant to serve 30 days conditional days jail, beginning today - with huber/work release

Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Probation review hearing.  State is asking for 30 days conditional time, starting today.  Def does not object.  Court - based on recommendations of DOC, Court orders 30 days conditional time in Richland County Jail - with huber but no good time (meaning that full 30 days to be served).
Hearing on August 12, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Probation review hearing requested by DOC.

Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def doesn't have counsel yet.  Court has instructed him to contact SPD.  Def is working; may not qualify.  Court recuses from this matter.

Once next judge is set, that judge will schedule the DOC-requested probation review matter and that Court will consider any request def might have re appointment of Dean counsel.
Hearing on August 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin L. Flint
Current: 1690 Wedgewood Drive, Apt. #2, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2016)
Prior: 28846 County Highway B, Lone Rock, WI 53556
of P/P for probation review hearing; presented to Court with proposed amendment to JOC calling for 30 days conditional jail time

Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  This was on for status, but DA states parties have a plea agreement.  DA - State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor possession of THC per 961.41(3g)(e); def pleading to both counts for probation of 2 years.  Court allows the amendment of Count 1.  To the charges, with count 1 as amended and count 2 as charged, def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.

Finding of guilty.  Sentence withheld for 24 months probation with conditions that Def attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming or counseling; pay court costs and costs of supervision.  Court finds Def to be eligible for first offender's treatment/expungement per 973.015, upon succ. completion of probation.  Atty. M asks for one set of costs.  So ordered.
Status conference at 06-24-2015 09:15 am

Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel request adjournment to June 24th.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Status conference at 06-17-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Matter was on the calendar for prelim but prelim did not occur and also has not been waived.  Counsel request additional further status.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing at 04-22-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Kevin L. Flint in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court states charges and informs def of possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to prelim.  Atty. M states def will waive prelim time limits but asks for prelim scheduling.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
